unnormalised: Someone asked me about the best way to ensure accurate delivery in India. It's a tricky question, honestly. Getting your package to the right place here can feel like winning the lottery sometimes!
normalised: Someone asked me about the best way to ensure accurate delivery in India. It is a tricky question, honestly. Getting your package to the right place here can feel like winning the lottery sometimes!

unnormalised: First, the most obvious thing: double, triple check your address. Write the full address, not just "near the big tree". I mean, include the house no., street name, locality, city, state AND the PIN code. Don't forget the PIN code! So many delivery guys rely on that. Something like "House No. 23, Saraswati Vihar, Phase 2, Gurgaon, Haryana, 122001" is MUCH better than just "Saraswati Vihar." And if there's a landmark, put that too, like "Opposite SBI Bank" or "Near the Main Market". Even better if you can add contact numbers.
normalised: First, the most obvious thing: double, triple check your address. Write the full address, not just "near the big tree". I mean, include the house number, street name, locality, city, state and the P-I-N code. Do not forget the P-I-N code! So many delivery guys rely on that. Something like "House Number twenty three, Saraswati Vihar, Phase two, Gurgaon, Haryana, one two two zero zero one" is much better than just "Saraswati Vihar." And if there is a landmark, put that too, like "Opposite S-B-I Bank" or "Near the Main Market". Even better if you can add contact numbers.

unnormalised: Next, see if the courier service offers address verification. Some of them, like Blue Dart or DTDC, might call the recipient to confirm the address, especially if it's a bit vague. Also, keep an eye on the tracking. If you see something weird, like the package being rerouted to a different city, call their customer service immediately. Don't wait until it's completely lost! Remember, India Post is reliable in smaller towns, use PIN code 400001.

unnormalised: Finally, be patient. Deliveries in India can take time, especially to remote areas. Don't expect Amazon Prime speeds everywhere. And be polite to the delivery person! A little kindness can go a long way in ensuring they put in that extra effort to find your place. Make sure to specify the proper state abbreviations, like "MH" for Maharashtra, in your address too! Good luck, and hope your parcel arrives safely!
